author: (Cuartoscuro)
title: #ZonaLibre | ¬øPor qu√© ser√° interesante nuestra elecci√≥n?
text:
‚ÄúLos viejejitos‚Äù, ‚Äúamor con amor se paga‚Äù, ‚Äúabrazos, no balazos‚Äù, ‚Äú¬°c√°llate, ‚Äòch√°chala‚Äô!‚Äù. ¬øCu√°ntas frases de AMLO recordar√°s? Debemos despedir para siempre de las boletas electorales a Andr√©s L√≥pez Obrador.
Con las elecciones presidenciales de M√©xico en el horizonte, al cercano 2 de junio, el panorama pol√≠tico est√° plagado de incertidumbre y expectativas. ¬øYa le damos la banda presidencial a Claudia Sheinbaum por su impresionante diferencia sobre X√≥chitl? ¬øEs invisible la oposici√≥n?
Publicidad Lee m√°s voces #ZonaLibre | Suplican nuestro voto Los candidatos contendientes se alinean, cada uno con su propia visi√≥n y promesas, mientras los ciudadanos deber√≠an evaluar sus opciones con cautela. En un pa√≠s marcado por la desigualdad, la corrupci√≥n y la violencia, los electores anhelan una l√≠der capaz de abordar estos problemas de manera efectiva.
La polarizaci√≥n pol√≠tica se hace cada d√≠a m√°s evidente. Es dolorosa e in√∫til; con fuerzas tanto de izquierda como de derecha luchando por el poder, sin tener al momento propuestas interesantes o que motiven a la participaci√≥n masiva. Los discursos populistas y las estrategias de propaganda inundan los medios, mientras los ciudadanos intentan discernir la verdad entre las promesas y las manipulaciones.
El papel de las redes sociales se ha vuelto fundamental, sirviendo como plataforma para la discusi√≥n pol√≠tica y la difusi√≥n de informaci√≥n (y desinformaci√≥n). Los candidatos compiten no solo en el terreno tradicional, sino tambi√©n en el virtual, buscando ganar la atenci√≥n y el apoyo de una poblaci√≥n cada vez m√°s conectada, pero decepcionada.
Lee m√°s voces #ColumnaInvitada | Una presidenta al frente de un pa√≠s desigual Sin embargo, a pesar de los desaf√≠os y las divisiones, las elecciones representan una oportunidad para que M√©xico elija un camino hacia el progreso y la estabilidad. ¬°S√≠, en serio!
La participaci√≥n ciudadana ser√° crucial en este proceso, ya que cada voto cuenta en la construcci√≥n del futuro de un pa√≠s que avanza y/o busca evolucionar.
Adi√≥s, AMLO. ¬øAdi√≥s, PRI?
La joven etapa democr√°tica mexicana no podr√≠a entenderse sin la participaci√≥n de Andr√©s Manuel L√≥pez Obrador. Lo ames o lo odies, se convirti√≥ en el personaje y l√≠der pol√≠tico m√°s influyente de los √∫ltimos 20 a√±os.
La primera vez que particip√≥ en una elecci√≥n fue en 1994 y durante cinco periodos electorales consecutivos particip√≥ en la b√∫squeda de alg√∫n cargo de elecci√≥n popular.
¬øLo extra√±aremos? ¬°Claro que s√≠! Sobre todo los creadores de memes pol√≠ticos. Sin Pe√±a Nieto y ahora sin AMLO, ¬øqu√© le espera a la comedia mexicana si nuestro deporte nacional es re√≠rnos de lo que hace nuestro presidente?
Lee m√°s voces #ZonaLibre | No se trata de ellos Ser√° la primera vez en la historia que no participar√° un candidato a la presidencia representando al Partido Revolucionario Institucional.
Es el partido pol√≠tico m√°s viejo de M√©xico. Fue hegem√≥nico y ‚Äòtodopoderoso‚Äô. Hoy se encuentra a un paso del precipicio y todo indica que su ca√≠da es estrepitosa.
Solamente Beatriz Paredes y Enrique De La Madrid se atrevieron a levantar la mano para ser postulados por el instituto que solo respira por la herida.
Pero quiz√° lo m√°s emblem√°tico e hist√≥rico de esta contienda ser√° que -muy, muy probablemente- una mujer llegar√° a ser presidenta por primera vez en nuestro pa√≠s.
Publicidad Lo √∫ltimo #ColumnaInvitada | ¬øQu√© ha logrado el 8 de marzo? #ColumnaInvitada | Jalisco, basti√≥n naranja dividido y en riesgo El Circo üé™| Portazo en la carpa, tensi√≥n en camerino y tres ausentes compadres Publicidad Es importante que recordemos los puntos importantes de la elecci√≥n del pr√≥ximo 2 de junio, pues la inminente intenci√≥n del abstencionismo electoral amenaza la salud democr√°tica del pa√≠s. Cada voto no emitido es una voz silenciada, un derecho desperdiciado. En un pa√≠s donde la participaci√≥n ciudadana es vital, la apat√≠a pol√≠tica socava el poder de la gente para influir en su propio destino.
Lee m√°s voces #ZonaLibre | Los j√≥venes y las urnas del 2024 El abstencionismo fortalece a cualquiera de los pol√≠ticos corruptos y debilita la legitimidad del gobierno.
Es momento de reconocer que la indiferencia no es una opci√≥n. Cada elecci√≥n es una oportunidad para generar cambio y moldear el futuro de M√©xico. ¬°Votar es un derecho, pero tambi√©n un deber -obligaci√≥n- c√≠vico que no se puede ignorar!
Lleguemos al 2 de junio con entendimiento; conozcamos la hoja de vida de los candidatos, analicemos propuestas y con una actitud positiva. Participar con nuestro voto es hist√≥rico y se convertir√° en un hito para nuestra manceba cultura democr√°tica.
Nota del editor: Las opiniones de este art√≠culo son responsabilidad √∫nica del autor.
Elecciones 2024 Citibanamex abre nueva fecha para recibir a Claudia Sheinbaum X√≥chitl analiza reanudar construcci√≥n del Aeropuerto de Texcoco... si gana #LIVE | Arranque de campa√±as: propuestas, promesas y acusaciones ver m√°s Publicidad Publicidad Tags Opini√≥n Elecciones 2024 Pol√≠tica Recomendaciones voces #ZonaLibre | Suplican nuestro voto 4 Min Read voces #ZonaLibre | No se trata de ellos 4 Min Read voces #ZonaLibre | Los j√≥venes y las urnas del 2024 4 Min Read M√°s acerca del autor: Caleb Ord√≥√±ez Caleb Ord√≥√±ez Talavera (1984) es abogado, comunicador y especialista en Periodismo digital por la Universidad Complutense de Madrid. Las opiniones expresadas en esta columna son exclusivas de su autor. @CalebMx MGID Recomienda Newsletter

author: @savrkelly
title: Grand Forks man sentenced to 25 years for attempted murder of police officers, other violent acts
text:
Grand Forks man sentenced to 25 years for attempted murder of police officers, other violent acts
Jeffrey Jacob Simpson Jr. was sentenced Wednesday afternoon, April 9. He has credit for 384 days served in custody.
GRAND FORKS ‚Äî A Grand Forks man was sentenced Wednesday, April 9, to 20 years in prison for the attempted murder of multiple law enforcement officers, and an additional five years for various, preceding domestic violence-related crimes.
Jeffrey Jacob Simpson Jr., 31, stood trial in March on seven felony charges. A jury found him guilty of all seven: four counts of Class A attempted murder and three counts of Class C felony reckless endangerment showing extreme indifference.
ADVERTISEMENT
Prior to trial, Simpson pleaded guilty
to Class B felony night burglary, Class C felony domestic violence causing serious bodily injury, two counts of Class C felony terrorizing with a dangerous weapon, Class C felony felonious restraint, Class A misdemeanor methamphetamine possession, Class A misdemeanor criminal mischief and Class B misdemeanor domestic violence causing bodily injury.
Court documents allege Simpson was brought to law enforcement's attention after his ex-girlfriend reported him for breaking into her home, strangling her, threatening to kill her while pressing a gun to her temple and underneath her chin, as well as causing other fear and physical harm.
She warned law enforcement that he had told her if she ever called the police on him, he would kill her and them, according to court statements.
With this concern in mind,
law enforcement initiated a SWAT team to arrest Simpson while he was working in the 3300 block of Primrose Court on March 22, 2024.
However, after they blocked his vehicle in,
Simpson exited and began firing at law enforcement.
He was ultimately apprehended with no injuries sustained to any involved.
In a victim impact statement read by the prosecution, Simpson's ex-girlfriend relayed the months of unrelenting terror that was her relationship with Simpson, and how she and her family continue to be affected.
She detailed injuries she sustained, threats and terrorizing behavior and how she has had lasting anxiety, nightmares and fear.
ADVERTISEMENT
"Despite the lasting effects Jeffrey has had on my life, for the past year, with Jeffrey being in jail, my life is slowly starting to come around," the woman wrote. "... Me and my family are closer now than we have ever been before, and we feel safe knowing that Jeffrey is in jail and can't hurt me."
She wrote that the promises that Simpson made ‚Äî to beat her, to shoot police ‚Äî have all happened.
"Jeffrey has promised to kill me, and I beg that he is never allowed the opportunity to fulfill yet another promise," the woman wrote.
Simpson's father, Jeffrey Simpson, asked the judge to consider his son's lack of criminal history and the fact that he was struggling with methamphetamine addiction at the time of the offenses.
"He is a good man," Jeffrey Simpson said. "Just, along the way, he lost himself. This is why it's so important that we make sure that he doesn't get lost in the system, but gets the help he needs to succeed."
The prosecution asked that Jeffrey Simpson Jr. be sentenced to a total of 35 years for his crimes, while Simpson's attorney ‚Äî David Ogren ‚Äî requested 20 years with 10 suspended.
"Unfortunately ‚Äî and I've learned this throughout the time of literally having done thousands of cases involving methamphetamine ‚Äî there comes that point where it takes over," Ogren said. "We have a man who had not previously had these issues, and very likely would have never had these issues hadn't meth raised its ugly head. Unfortunately, many, many people have fallen into that."
ADVERTISEMENT
Judge Jay Knudson acknowledged the statements about Simpson's addiction, but said they did not justify or excuse his criminal acts. He pointed out that Simpson's acts harmed many people, and he has never shown remorse for what he has done, particularly to his ex-girlfriend.
"You planned exactly what happened," Knudson said. "You got what you asked for. I understand addiction is a problem, but a methamphetamine addiction is not an excuse to terrorize a girlfriend or shoot it out with law enforcement."
He sentenced Simpson to a total of 25 years in prison, followed by three years of supervised probation.
Simpson has credit for 384 days served. He is prohibited from having contact with any of the victims in the case, and must complete a domestic violence assessment and related treatment if the assessment deems necessary.
ADVERTISEMENT

author: Hermann Kollinger
title: D: 55 Ehrenamtliche retten in Sankt Augustin Wohnhaus vor den Flammen
text:
SANKT AUGUSTIN (DEUTSCHLAND): Drei Einheiten der Freiwilligen Feuerwehr Sankt Augustin wurden um 14:07 Uhr des 10. Juli 2025 zu einem Dachbrand im Ortsteil Buisdorf alarmiert.
Bei Eintreffen sah der Einsatzleiter eine Hochterrasse der ersten Etage in Vollbrand und forderte mit einer Alarmstufenerh√∂hung auf ‚ÄûBrand 4‚Äú zwei weitere Einheiten an, weil das das Feuer das gesamte Haus bedrohte. Umgehend l√∂schten die freiwilligen Feuerwehrleute den Anbau von au√üen mit zwei Schlauchleitungen und √ºber die Drehleiter; sie brachten das Feuer schnell unter Kontrolle und verhinderten durch eine Riegelstellung eine Brandausbreitung auf das Haupthaus.
Die Bewohner des Hauses hatten sich zuvor eigenst√§ndig in Sicherheit gebracht, es gab keine Verletzten. Allerdings ist das Obergeschoss momentan nicht bewohnbar. Einschlie√ülich Polizei und Rettungsdienst waren insgesamt etwa 65 Kr√§fte im Einsatz.

author: Qatar Tribune
title: Russian plane with 34 on board lands on frozen river by mistake - Read Qatar Tribune on the go for unrivalled news coverage
text:
In the Far East of Russia, a passenger plane carrying 34 people made an emergency landing on a frozen river, presumably due to a pilot error.
The Soviet-era Antonov An-24 aircraft operated by Polar Airlines came to an abrupt stop on Thursday morning on the frozen River Kolyma, not far from land. Fortunately, no one was injured.
The aircraft touched down on the Zyryanka airport
runway.
Prosecutors said that initial investigations indicated pilot error was the cause. On board were thirty passengers and four crew members.
Early on Thursday, the Sakha republic‚Äôs capital city of Yakutsk in the Far East of Russia saw the departure of Flight PI217.
It was bound for Zyryanka, 1,100km (685 miles) to the north-east, and was due to fly on to another small town in Srednekolymsk before returning to Yakutsk.
Video from one of the passengers showed the plane almost in the centre of the frozen River Kolyma in eastern Siberia. Temperatures in Zyryanka dip to around -40C at this time of year.
Prosecutors said the plane had landed on a sand bank in the river. A trail in the snow revealed how long it had taken to come to a standstill. (Agencies)
 Copy 29/12/2023 25

author: Liz Dye
title: Lively-Baldoni Lawyers Play Smashmouth Along With Their Clients
text:
Lively-Baldoni Lawyers Play Smashmouth Along With Their Clients
It's fun to light money on fire!
The Blake Lively-Justin Baldoni litigation is off to a predictably batshit start, with Lively‚Äôs lead counsel already accusing his counterpart of professional misconduct and defamation.
The fun started on New Year‚Äôs Eve when Lively filed a sexual harassment complaint in New York against her former co-star and producer, along with his production company Wayfarer and various publicists and partners. At the very same time, Baldoni was docketing a spectacularly ill-judged defamation suit in California state suit against the New York Times, alleging that it laundered false claims from Lively‚Äôs civil administrative complaint to spare the actor from having to defend herself in court:
Sponsored
Precision Meets AI: Thomson Reuters' New Era Of Legal Research
Notably, Lively chose not to file a lawsuit against Baldoni, Wayfarer, or any of the Plaintiffs‚Äîa choice that spared her from the scrutiny of the discovery process, including answering questions under oath and producing her communications. This decision was no accident. First, her administrative complaint is rife with blatant falsehoods and egregious misrepresentations that would have subjected her to dismissal if not sanctions. Second, pursuing formal legal action would have derailed her true objective: an orchestrated campaign to rehabilitate her public image.
On January 16, Baldoni et al filed suit in New York against Lively, along with her husband Ryan Reynolds, demanding $400 million for defamation and ‚Äúcivil extortion.‚Äù
The cases were designated as related, and both landed on the docket of Judge Lewis Liman, who just got rid of Rudy Giuliani and is probably wondering what he‚Äôs done to deserve a double portion of this bullshit.
Correspondence docketed by Lively‚Äôs lawyer Michael Gottlieb of Willkie Farr shows that he tried to effectuate service through Baldoni‚Äôs lawyer Bryan Freedman, an experienced media litigator from California. Freedman not only ignored those requests, but disregarded Gottlieb‚Äôs attempt to waive personal service for Lively and Reynolds.
Sponsored
Sponsored
Happy Lawyers, Better Results The Key To Thriving In Tough Times
Sponsored
A New AI-Powered Practice Management Platform With Flexible Deployment Options
Sponsored
AI Presents Both Opportunities And Risks For Lawyers. Are You Prepared?
Sponsored
A New AI-Powered Practice Management Platform With Flexible Deployment Options
‚ÄúPlaintiffs‚Äô process servers made attempts at service on the evening of January 18, 2025, which resulted in one of Defendants‚Äô employees (who is not a party to this action) being followed to the residence in which she was staying by an unknown vehicle down a dark road late at night,‚Äù Gottlieb complained in a letter to the court on January 19. ‚ÄúThis conduct was sufficiently alarming as to cause that employee to file a police report.‚Äù
Freedman counters that Lively and Reynolds falsely attested that Baldoni requested the waiver of personal service in his offensive suit. To be fair, they signed the standard form waiver which says ‚ÄúI have received your request to waive service of a summons in this action along with a copy of the complaint,‚Äù since it does not appear to have occurred to the Southern District of New York that a plaintiff would insist on his right to harass a defendant by executing personal service. But waiving service extends the time to reply from 30 days to 60, and so Freedman demands that his clients‚Äô response deadlines be extended to harmonize them with the earlier-filed suit.
‚ÄúIn sum, the Lively Parties falsely engineered an extension of time, until March 20, 2025, to respond to the Complaint in the Wayfarer Case but now refuse to consent to the same deadline for the Wayfarer Parties, even though doing is in the interests of justice and efficiency in cases that are not only related but likely will be consolidated,‚Äù he huffs.
Meanwhile, Freedman has been going on every podcast he can to trash Lively, and she is PISSED. Since December 20, Gottlieb has been sending cease and desist [letters](https://storage.courtlistener.com/recap/gov.uscourts.nysd.635145/gov.uscourts.nysd.635145.29.3.pdf) accusing Baldoni and Freedman of defaming his clients by falsely claiming that Wayfarer took ‚Äúno proactive measures ‚Ä¶ with media or otherwise‚Äù and ‚Äúonly responded to incoming media inquiries to ensure balanced and factual reporting and monitored social activity‚Äù prior to the New York Times article about Baldoni.
‚ÄúLawyers are not publicity agents. We are required to follow a different set of professional standards than publicists and crisis managers. One of those standards is the prohibition against knowingly making factual misrepresentations, even when doing so would help defend or promote our clients‚Äô interests,‚Äù Gottlieb warned, noting that the California Rules of Professional Conduct require lawyers to refrain from public misrepresentations. The letter also accuses Freedman of continuing his client‚Äôs breach of the agreement signed in November of 2023, which barred Baldoni from retaliating against Lively as a condition of her return to finish the film.
Sponsored
[Sponsored](https://abovethelaw.com/2025/01/precision-meets-ai-thomson-reuters-new-era-of-legal-research)
[
Precision Meets AI: Thomson Reuters' New Era Of Legal Research ](https://abovethelaw.com/2025/01/precision-meets-ai-thomson-reuters-new-era-of-legal-research)
[Sponsored](https://abovethelaw.com/2024/12/generative-ai-at-work-boosting-e-discovery-efficiency-for-corporate-legal-teams/)
[
Generative AI at Work: Boosting e-Discovery Efficiency for Corporate Legal Teams ](https://abovethelaw.com/2024/12/generative-ai-at-work-boosting-e-discovery-efficiency-for-corporate-legal-teams/)
In a [letter](https://storage.courtlistener.com/recap/gov.uscourts.nysd.635145/gov.uscourts.nysd.635145.29.0.pdf) to Judge Liman, Gottlieb accused Freedman of deliberately seeking to prejudice the jury pool, in violation of N.Y. Rules of Pro. Conduct 3.6(a), which bars an attorney from making ‚Äúan extrajudicial statement that the lawyer knows or reasonably should know will be disseminated by means of public communication and will have a substantial likelihood of materially prejudicing an adjudicative proceeding in the matter.‚Äù
‚ÄúThe Lively-Reynolds Parties intend to seek an appropriate protective order to govern further proceedings in this case, but given the imminent harm caused by Mr. Freedman‚Äôs misleading and selective statements and leaks, we respectfully request that this Court schedule a hearing as soon as possible to address the appropriate conduct of counsel moving forward in these two related matters,‚Äù he concluded.
As of now, Judge Liman appeared uninterested in wading into this sniping. This afternoon he issued a [show cause order](https://storage.courtlistener.com/recap/gov.uscourts.nysd.635145/gov.uscourts.nysd.635145.37.0.pdf) demanding to know why these cases should not be consolidated.
[Wayfarer v. Lively](https://www.courtlistener.com/docket/69550325/wayfarer-studios-llc-v-lively/?filed_after=&filed_before=&entry_gte=&entry_lte=&order_by=asc) [Docket via Court Listener]
[Lively v. Wayfarer](https://www.courtlistener.com/docket/69510553/lively-v-wayfarer-studios-llc/?filed_after=&filed_before=&entry_gte=&entry_lte=&order_by=desc) [Docket via Court Listener]
[Liz Dye](https://bsky.app/profile/lizdye.bsky.social) lives in Baltimore where she produces the Law and Chaos [substack](https://www.lawandchaospod.com/) and [podcast](https://podcasts.apple.com/us/podcast/law-and-chaos/id1727769913).
topics: Arts, Culture and Entertainment->arts and entertainment

author: Amy Williams
title: 8 Olive Garden Menu Items to Avoid, and 3 to Pick Instead - NewsBreak
text:
By Amy Williams ,
8 hours ago When someone mentions Olive Garden, you can probably start to smell those delicious breadsticks. There‚Äôs no doubt this restaurant is one of the most popular chains for soup, salad, and pasta fans. From their creamy and delicious Alfredo sauce to their never-ending soup or salad and breadsticks deal, what‚Äôs not to love?
Most people don‚Äôt consider Olive Garden healthy but even if you‚Äôre not counting calories, there are some menu items at Olive Garden you should avoid. If you‚Äôre not careful, you can end up consuming all your daily calories (and more!) from just one meal at this restaurant. If you want to enjoy a meal at Olive Garden but not overdo it, here are some menu items to avoid and ones to pick instead.
Avoid the Spinach Artichoke Dip ¬©New Africa/Shutterstock.com
If there‚Äôs spinach in the name, it must be healthy, right? Well, not exactly. The Spinach Artichoke Dip at Olive Garden is certainly tasty, but the appetizer contains 1,160 calories. Even if you‚Äôre sharing it with a friend or two, that‚Äôs still a lot of calories , fat, and sodium you‚Äôre adding to your meal.
Avoid the Fried Mozzarella ¬©Ezume Images/Shutterstock.com
The only thing better than mozzarella cheese is mozzarella cheese breaded and fried. As comforting as this dish is, it‚Äôs 800 calories without the marinara sauce. It also has 1,990 mg of sodium, plus another 320 mg of sodium if you choose to dip it in the sauce.
Avoid the Cheese Ravioli ¬©Alesia.Bierliezova/Shutterstock.com
Cheese ravioli is a classic choice when you‚Äôre in the mood for a portion of delicious, cheesy pasta. Whether you choose to top it with marinara sauce, meat sauce, or Alfredo, it might seem like one of the best options at Olive Garden . Unfortunately, the Cheese Ravioli leaves much to be desired in the cheese filling, which certainly doesn‚Äôt make it worth the 800 calories.
Avoid the Seafood Alfredo ¬©Elena Veselova/Shutterstock.com
The Alfredo sauce at Olive Garden is so delicious that you can even order it as a dipping sauce for your breadsticks . Despite how delicious the sauce is, this dish isn‚Äôt worth over $20 or 1,470 calories. If you want to order a seafood dish at Olive Garden, there are better alternatives.
Avoid the Chicken Tortelloni Alfredo ¬©alisafarov/Shutterstock.com
The Chicken Tortelloni Alfredo is another dish that comes with Olive Garden‚Äôs iconic sauce. Instead of fettuccini, this dish comes with cheese-filled tortelloni noodles. Before you order this dish though, keep in mind it contains nearly 2,000 calories and 3,720 mg of sodium.
Avoid the Tour of Italy ¬©Rahmiayu92/Shutterstock.com
When you can‚Äôt decide what dish you want, the Tour of Italy may seem like the logical choice. This meal gives you a taste of the Chicken Parmigiana, Lasagna Classico, and Fettuccine Alfredo. However, this meal is also a whopping 1,550 calories and if you enjoy an appetizer, drink, or dessert, your entire meal could be well over 2,000 calories.
Avoid the Meatballs Parmigiana ¬©RFondren Photography/Shutterstock.com
Even though it could be a full meal, the Meatballs Parmigiana is an appetizer on the Olive Garden menu. With five meatballs smothered in marinara sauce and cheese, there are over 1,000 calories in this appetizer alone. It also includes 83 grams of fat and 2,800 mg of sodium.
Avoid the Chocolate Lasagna ¬©Candice Bell/Shutterstock.com
There‚Äôs nothing wrong with enjoying a delectable dessert every once in a while, but if the dessert is going to be nearly 1,000 calories, it better be worth it. Unfortunately, the Chocolate Lasagna is not only 980 calories but it‚Äôs also a tad disappointing. If you‚Äôre going to enjoy a dessert after your meal, try the Tiramisu instead.
Try the Grilled Chicken Margherita ¬©Iryna Pospikh/Shutterstock.com
If you‚Äôre looking for a tasty meal at Olive Garden that doesn‚Äôt contain all your daily calories, try the Grilled Chicken Margherita. This dish includes grilled chicken breast topped with tomatoes, mozzarella cheese, and basil pesto. The Grilled Chicken Margherita has only 640 calories and 65 grams of protein.
Try the Shrimp Scampi ¬©Liudmyla Chuhunova/Shutterstock.com
If you had your eye on the Seafood Alfredo, the Shrimp Scampi is a great alternative. With this dish, you still get a mix of delicious flavors but without the heaviness and extra calories. The Shrimp Scampi includes shrimp, asparagus, tomatoes, and angel hair pasta tossed in a tasty garlic sauce.
Try the Spaghetti & Meatballs ¬©iStock.com/LauriPatterson
You can‚Äôt go wrong with a classic like Spaghetti & Meatballs. Even though this is still a high-calorie meal, there‚Äôs more of a balance of calories and protein than some of the other pasta dishes. If you choose the spaghetti with marinara sauce, it will have about 940 calories and close to 50 grams of protein.
The image featured at the top of this post is ¬©Evgeny Karandaev/Shutterstock.com.
Up Next: The post 8 Olive Garden Menu Items to Avoid, and 3 to Pick Instead appeared first on Moms Who Think .
24

author: Reda√ß√£o
title: Lula: Vou mostrar a Bolsonaro que quem est√° na Presid√™ncia s√≥ perde elei√ß√£o se for incompetente
text:
27/06/2024 - 18:10
O presidente Luiz In√°cio Lula da Silva afirmou que n√£o tem preocupa√ß√£o se o ex-presidente Jair Bolsonaro (PL) poder√° se candidatar novamente ao Pal√°cio do Planalto e sugeriu que haveria mais condi√ß√µes de derrot√°-lo em 2026.
As declara√ß√µes ocorreram em entrevista √† R√°dio Itatiaia, nesta quinta-feira, 27, em Minas Gerais.
‚ÄúEu n√£o me preocupo se ele vai ser candidato ou n√£o. Eu n√£o veto candidato advers√°rio‚Äù, disse o presidente. ‚ÄúSe ele conquistar o direito de ser candidato, que seja candidato.‚Äù
Lula continuou: ‚ÄúOra, se eu derrotei ele quando eu era oposi√ß√£o e ele situa√ß√£o, imagina agora que sou situa√ß√£o e ele, oposi√ß√£o. Eu vou mostrar para ele que quem est√° na Presid√™ncia s√≥ perde uma elei√ß√£o se for incompetente‚Äù.
Questionado se a declara√ß√£o seria uma confirma√ß√£o de sua candidatura √† reelei√ß√£o em 2026, Lula recuou.
‚ÄúN√£o, n√£o. Tamb√©m √© cedo. Eu sou um jovem de 78 anos de idade, eu me considero em pleno estado de sa√∫de, eu tenho muita for√ßa f√≠sica, eu tenho muita capacidade de trabalho. Mas eu n√£o vou levar o povo brasileiro a cometer um erro. Eu vou chegar no momento certo‚Äù, disse.
Lula acrescentou: ‚ÄúN√£o precisa ser eu. A √∫nica hip√≥tese que eu disse que eu posso ser candidato √© que se todos os indicadores mostrarem que eu sou a √∫nica pessoa para derrotar o fascismo e a extrema-direita, eu n√£o teria problema de ser candidato. Mas eu espero que a gente, at√© l√°, arrume uma pessoa mais competente, mais jovem e com mais disposi√ß√£o‚Äù.
Bolsonaro foi condenado √† inelegibilidade por oito anos pelo Tribunal Superior Eleitoral (TSE) em junho de 2023. No julgamento, os magistrados identificaram abuso de poder pol√≠tico e uso indevido dos meios de comunica√ß√£o.

author: internet@elsiglodetorreon.com.mx (EFE)
title: Israel sigue ofensiva en Gaza; enfoca operaciones a mediano plazo
text: Gobierno israel√≠ sigue sin dar detalles claros sobre qui√©n pretende que tenga el poder en Gaza. (EFE) [EFE](https://www.google.com/search?as_sitesearch=elsiglodetorreon.com.mx&q=EFE) El Ej√©rcito israel√≠ sigui√≥ este jueves con su ofensiva en Gaza, donde contin√∫an los duros combates con Ham√°s y aumentan los muertos, en un contexto en que Israel asume que sus operaciones ir√°n por largo y debe comenzar a planear un escenario a medio plazo. Mientras Ham√°s va difundiendo videos donde se ve a sus milicias haciendo emboscadas y atacando tropas y tanques israel√≠es, el Ej√©rcito contin√∫a realizando operaciones en el norte, centro y sur de la Franja, entre ellas en la urbe meridional de Jan Yunis, donde las fuerzas israel√≠es "llevan a cabo misiones sin precedentes", dijo este jueves el ministro de Defensa israel√≠, Yoav Gallant. "Nuestras fuerzas llegan a zonas en las que nunca antes hab√≠amos estado, tomando salas de control y eliminando a terroristas", a√±adi√≥ Gallant, durante una visita en el cuartel general de la Divisi√≥n 98, cuerpo militar que combate ahora en el √°rea de Jan Yunis. A su vez, las tropas intensifican su incursi√≥n militar en el √°rea sur de la Franja, operaci√≥n que iniciaron semanas atr√°s, centr√°ndose tambi√©n ah√≠ en alcanzar "los centros de mando, dep√≥sitos de armas e instalaciones de producci√≥n" de armamento de las milicias. Todo ello, reiter√≥ Gallant, con "la tarea de desmantelar a Ham√°s para que ya no tenga capacidad militar ni de Gobierno", fin para el que las fuerzas israel√≠es deber√°n demostrar "mucha perseverancia y determinaci√≥n". Desde el inicio de la invasi√≥n terrestre en Gaza el 27 de octubre, al menos 167 soldados israel√≠es han muerto, mientras que la cifra de militares -tanto activos como reservistas- fallecidos desde el ataque de Ham√°s del pasado 7 de octubre super√≥ este jueves los 500. Todo ello, mientras los ataques y bombardeos de Israel siguieron causando en las √∫ltimas horas cientos de muertos palestinos, que son m√°s de 21.300 en los m√°s de dos meses y medio de ofensiva, a lo que se a√±ade una crisis humanitaria causada por el duro cerco israel√≠ sobre Gaza, que la ha dejado con gran escasez de alimentos, recursos esenciales, medicamentos, agua potable o gasolina para electricidad. Seg√∫n la agencia oficial de noticias Wafa, decenas de palestinos murieron este jueves debido a bombardeos sobre viviendas en el sur de Gaza, √°rea donde se concentran gran parte de los 1,9 millones de desplazados internos en el enclave. En la urbe de Rafah, punto m√°s meridional del enclave, "al menos 20 ciudadanos murieron y decenas resultaron heridos como resultado de un bombardeo israel√≠ que tuvo como objetivo una casa". Los aviones de combate israel√≠es tambi√©n "lanzaron ataques contra una casa del campo de refugiados de Shaboura", en Rafah, que caus√≥ asimismo "decenas de fallecidos y heridos, la mayor√≠a mujeres y ni√±os", concret√≥ Wafa. Por otro lado, m√°s de 25 personas murieron en varios ataques sobre Jan Yunis, detall√≥ la misma fuente. A su vez, entre otros incidentes, se inform√≥ de ataques en las localidades norte√±as de Beit Han√∫n o Beit Lahia, que incluyeron tambi√©n decenas de v√≠ctimas mortales, mientras las tropas israel√≠es siguen atacando el campo de refugiados de Al Maghazi, en la ciudad de Deir Balah, en el centro de Gaza, objeto de bombardeos casi constantes durante los √∫ltimos d√≠as. Los servicios m√©dicos de la Media Luna Roja palestina informaron que sus equipos trasladaron al hospital a tres muertos y seis heridos por ataques contra una casa en el campo de Al Maghazi. Sus equipos m√©dicos tambi√©n trabajan ahora con la Media Luna Roja de Egipto para crear un campamento para desplazados en la zona de Jan Yunis, que se espera que alcance las 1.000 tiendas de campa√±a. Todo ello se produce mientras Israel tiene que ir planeando sus actuaciones a medio plazo en Gaza, y un plan para la posguerra que por ahora no parece estar determinado, lo que genera preocupaci√≥n a su principal aliado, Estados Unidos. Justo este jueves, el secretario de Defensa estadounidense, Lloyd Austin, habl√≥ con Gallant y discuti√≥ aspectos de "los preparativos para la fase de estabilizaci√≥n que debe seguir a las operaciones de combate", inform√≥ el Pent√°gono. La Casa Blanca estar√≠a presionando a Israel para que reduzca la intensidad de los ataques en Gaza, aunque Gallant dijo hace poco que estos se podr√≠an prolongar todav√≠a durante varios meses m√°s. Por otro lado, seg√∫n prensa israel√≠, el primer ministro israel√≠, Benjam√≠n Netanyahu, deb√≠a celebrar este jueves una reuni√≥n de su Gabinete de Guerra para abordar posibles planes para la posguerra en Gaza, pese a que finalmente cancel√≥ el encuentro, mientras el Gobierno israel√≠ sigue sin dar detalles claros sobre qui√©n pretende que tenga el poder en Gaza o c√≥mo deber√≠a gestionarse su reconstrucci√≥n. Seg√∫n medios israel√≠es, Netanyahu no quiso realizar encuentros para abordar esta cuesti√≥n hasta ahora, lo que preocupa a la Administraci√≥n Biden, que teme que el Ej√©rcito israel√≠ se quede estancado dentro del enclave indefinidamente.

author: WAKA Action 8 News
title: Gov. Kay Ivey deploys search and rescue team to help with Texas flood recovery - WAKA 8
text:
by WAKA Action 8 News FILE ‚Äì Gov. Kay Ivey ‚Äì Photo from Office of Gov. Kay Ivey
Gov. Kay Ivey announced today that the state will help Texas in search and rescue missions following the devastating flooding.
The 40-person team she is deploying includes Alabama Task Force 1 of Mobile, Tuscaloosa Fire and Saraland Fire.
‚ÄúSearch and rescue remains the goal, and Alabama is going to do all we can to lend a helping hand to Texas,‚Äù Gov. Ivey said in a statement.
‚ÄúWe are heartbroken in Alabama to have lost two of our own. I pray for Sarah Marsh‚Äôs family as they navigate the unimaginable loss of their precious daughter. My prayers are also with the Santanas as they grieve the loss of Camille and are still searching for three members of their family. Truly, we are all grieving alongside these Alabamians, as well as those in Texas and across our country.‚Äù
This team is capable of conducting search and rescue response efforts for all hazards, including locating, accessing, medically stabilizing and extricating survivors from impacted structures and areas. Specialized operational personnel include rescue, canine search, medical, hazmat, technical search and communications.
‚ÄúI am grateful to all those who are part of the search and rescue mission, and I pray for their safety and for the success of their mission. Y‚Äôall, pray for Texas!‚Äù Gov. Ivey said.
The team is deploying today. This task force operates in 12-hour periods for up to 14 days.
‚Äî Information from Office of Governor Kay Ivey
